title: kishin_sagume
body:
[b]Goddess who Invites Unfortunate Slips of the Tongue[/b]

Stage 4 midboss and boss of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. A high-ranked Lunarian and goddess who has the power to reverse a situation with her words, so she always has to watch what she says. She is responsible for the events in [[Urban Legend in Limbo]], making it possible for [[Usami Sumireko]] to find the Occult Ball for the Lunar Capital so the Lunarians can invade [[Gensokyo]].

She has short [[white hair]] with a [[braid]], [[red eyes]], a white jacket, a [[purple skirt]] with cut-in pleats, and a [[single wing]] on the right side of her back.

Her power is frequently referred to as a "powered up [[kijin seija|Seija]]", thus causing the two to be frequently seen together in fanart.

h4. Related Pools

* Pool #11141:  Touhou - Sagume's Hazardous Slips of the Tongue
* Pool #21359:  Touhou - Fancy Winged Sagume

title: fernando_alonso
body:
A Spanish [[racecar]] driver primarily known for his career in [[Formula One]], where he currently drives for [[Aston Martin]]. He has won the championship twice with [[Renault]], and has made appearances in both the [[World Endurance Championship]] and [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]] - winning the [[circuit de la sarthe|24 Hours of Le Mans]] and [[daytona international speedway|24 Hours of Daytona]] twice each.

As of 2024, he is the only driver to be a champion in both F1 and WEC, even if [[World SportsCar Championship]] results are taken into account.

title: luste_teuber
body:
A character from [[Rosenkreuzstilette]] who is easily noticeable for the fact that her only garments are a black collar, a very revealing black [[bikini]] with a cross on her bra, black arm gloves and tights, silver rings floating around her wrists, and white shoes. In simple words, she has terrible fashion sense. Luste is a cheerful, playful, optimistic and easygoing young girl with bat wings and fangs in her mouth who likes to play and have fun. She is self-centered and likes to pretend herself to be a hero of justice, despite wrecking everything in sight. She looks up to [[Spiritia Rosenberg|Spiritia Rosenberg]] a lot and likes to roleplay with her with Tia roleplaying the bad guy. She also loves tomato juice. In [[Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel]], she [[cosplay|dresses herself up]] as a [[superhero costume|superhero]] and takes on the name of "???" (or Unbekannt) with a secret identity, though anyone can guess who she is thanks to her physical appearance still being exposed.

Her weapon is Lustatem, which allows her to shoot wind energy in the form of blades in any direction.

title: batman:_the_animated_series
body: Batman: The Animated Series (often shortened as Batman TAS or BTAS) is an American animated superhero television series based on the [[DC Comics]] superhero [[Batman]].

title: the_crow_(comic)
body:
[b]The Crow[/b] is a supernatural superhero [[comic]] book series created by [[united states|American]] comic writer and artist "James O'Barr":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_O'Barr revolving around the titular character of the same name. 

The series, which was originally created by O'Barr as a means of dealing with the death of his fiancée at the hands of a drunk driver, was first published by "Caliber Comics":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caliber_Comics in 1989. 

It became an underground success, and was later adapted into [[the crow (film)|a film of the same name]] in 1994. Three film sequels, a television series, and numerous books and comic books (published by numerous companies) have also been subsequently produced.

The Crow has been translated into almost a dozen languages and has sold around 750,000 copies worldwide.

h4.Characters
* [[Eric Draven]]

title: eric_draven
body:
Main protagonist of [[The Crow (comic)|]] supernatural superhero action [[comic]] from 1989.

[b]Eric Draven[/b] [spoilers]is a murdered indie rock musician brought back to life by the supernatural powers of a mystical [[crow]] to avenge both his and his fiancée deaths at the hands of a brutal band of drugdealers and criminals.[/spoilers] He wears a [[superhero costume]].

title: t'challa
body: T’Challa is a [[Marvel]] superhero. He is the king of the secretive and highly advanced African nation of Wakanda - as well as the powerful warrior known as the [[Black Panther (Marvel)|]].

title: valentina_(darna)
body:
A supervillainness who is the archnemesis of the Filipino superheroine [[Darna (character)|]]. 

Among Darna's rogues' gallery, Valentina is the most popular. She is also the most famous Filipino supervillain character, just like her archnemesis Darna being the most famous Filipino superhero character. 

Valentina has a Gorgon-like appearance due to her signature [[snake hair]] (in fact, some Filipino fans who are unfamiliar with the Gorgons from Greek mythology may associate other fictional characters having snake hair as a reference to Valentina instead). Depending on the series and adaptations, she may possess other snake-like traits, such as having [[slit pupils]], a [[forked tongue]], [[scales|scaled skin]], [[fangs]], and a venomous bite (either from her fangs, her snake hair, or both).

title: darna_(character)
body:
The eponymous superheroine and main protagonist of the Filipino comic book series [[Darna]], which has been adapted into multiple movies and TV series in the [[Philippines]]. 

She is the superheroine alter-ego of a young girl or woman named [[Narda (Darna)|]]. And depending on the adaptation or comic book universe, they can either be the same or separate characters from each other. 

To transform into Darna, Narda swallows a pebble-sized magic white stone (with Darna's name engraved onto it. That is how she learned the superheroine's name) first and then shouts her superheroine alter-ego's name. To change back into Narda, Darna shouts her human alter-ego's name instead and after changing back, Narda regurgitates the white stone she swallowed. 

Darna's [[superhero costume]]s follow a specific but iconic design (though those has some minor differences from other series or adaptations): she usually wears a red [[bikini]] (with either a [[strapless bra]] or [[strapless bikini]] top) or shorts with a gold star in each [[bra|brassiere]] cup; red [[helmet]] with a gold winged, [[v-fin]]-like, medallion on its center (the medallion may or may not be encrusted with [[red gemstone|ruby]]); gold bracelets; a golden medallion belt with a loincloth in the middle; and red boots. 

Darna's superpowers are mostly similar to [[Superman]]'s, such as super strength, super speed, flight, super senses, and nigh invulnerability. In some versions, if the gold winged medallion on her helmet has a ruby encrusted onto it, she can use it as a powerful weapon by firing a red laser [[beam]] from it. 

Darna is widely considered as a Filipino cultural icon and the most celebrated superhero character in the Philippines.

title: narda_(darna)
body:
The human alter-ego of the Filipino superheroine [[Darna (character)|]].

Depending on the series or adaptation, Narda may be either a similar or a separate character from Darna. Also, she can either be a young girl, a teenager or an adult woman.

Her name is an anagram of her superheroine alter-ego's. Narda also has a younger brother named Ding.

title: ougon_bat_(character)
body:
The titular character from the [[Ougon Bat]] supernatural action superhero franchise. He is also known as [b]Phantoma[/b] in English, [b]Fantasmagórico[/b] in Spanish and [b]Fantaman[/b] in Italian.

The character was created by writer Ichiro Suzuki and illustrator Takeo Nagamatsu in 1930. Ougon Bat made his debut in [i]Kamishibai[/i], a traveling show in which a sequence of pictures is narrated by a storyteller and was very famous before [[World War II]]. 

In these early stories Ougon Bat was a superhero that had a golden skull shaped head, a green and white 17th century [[superhero costume|costume]] with a high collared red [[cape]] and was armed with a [[rapier]] [[sword]]. He possessed superhuman strength and invulnerability as well as the ability to fly. He also lived in a fortress in the Japanese Alps.

In the TV anime and the live action films from the 60s the character was a “God of justice and protector of the weak” from the ancient and legendary lost city of Atlantis who was put into suspended animation in a sarcophagus to be awakened in the future to fight the forces of evil. In the anime the character still has a golden skull head and the red cape, but now has a golden [[armor]]ed [[bodysuit]] and is armed with a [[staff]].

In the cancelled late 90s remake the character was re-imagined with a new skinnier and more gruesome look with vampire fangs in the golden skull as well as having the ability to fly with bat wings instead of the original [[Superman]]-styled flight. The powers of Ougon Bat also were upgraded and he now has the ability to perform several powerful energy attacks.

title: hero_factory
body:
A [[science fiction]] toyline of constructible action figures from [[the lego group|LEGO]] that ran from 2010 to 2014. Replaced [[Bionicle]] after its discontinuation and introduced the Character and Creature Building System (CCBS) for constructible action figures. The premise behind the line focuses on the titular Hero Factory, which mass produces [[humanoid robot|mechanical]] superheroes to respond to crises throughout the galaxy. A short animated series and comics for the line were released throughout it's run.

The line faced criticism for having much simpler sets and less intricate lore than Bionicle. Despite this, the CCBS pieces have since replaced Bionicle and Technic parts for LEGO's constructible action figures, and went on to be used for the 2015 Bionicle reboot, as well as [[Star Wars]] and [[Marvel]] sets.
other_names: ヒーローファクトリー

title: dr._manhattan
body:
A superhero from [[Watchmen]]. Dr. Manhattan was formerly an atomic physicist named Jon Osterman who gained near god-like powers following a lab accident that destroyed his physical body. His new body takes the form of a [[bald]], [[nude]], [[toned male]] with [[blue skin|blue]] [[glowing skin]]. His forehead is marked with the atomic structure of hydrogen, which he chose for himself as his own icon.

He is notable for being the only character in the comic that has supernatural powers.

title: miles_morales
body:
Tag refers to any image referencing the [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] character Miles Morales, who is one of the many alternative versions of the iconic superhero costume [[Spider-Man]]. 

Most versions of Miles depict him as an African-American teen boy with either a faded buzz cut or dreadlocks. He [[superhero costume|wears]] a [[Spider-Man (Miles Morales)|variation]] of the iconic Spider-Man suit with a black base and red outlines instead of red and blue. His origin story and his movie debut ([[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse]]) portray him struggling to live up to the original Spider-Man's legacy after his untimely death, as well as the responsibilities and isolation that comes with his great newfound powers.

He was created in the early 2010s, and is notable for being the first (widely recognized) Spider-Man of African and Latino ancestry. While others such as Spider-Punk and Spider-Man 2099 existed, Miles was created during President Barack Obama's second term, and was created in part because of what Obama represented to his supporters as the first black president of the United States. This allowed Marvel to push him into the attention of their most dedicated fans. Marvel was soon able to make him known to general audiences with his appearances in the Insomniac Games' [[Spider-Man (2018 game)|Spider-Man games]], Into The Spider-Verse, and numerous children's cartoons in the late 2010s.

However, it only lasts for five minutes, and has a cooldown time of approximately one hour. He wears a [[superhero costume]] in this form.

While [[Barnaby Brooks Jr.]]. attacks with [[kicking|kicks]], Wild Tiger prefers [[punching]].

title: kaburagi_t._kotetsu
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Tiger & Bunny]], and [[Barnaby Brooks Jr.]].'s partner. His superhero code name is [[Wild Tiger]].

Kotetsu is a veteran hero who dedicates his life to using his NEXT powers to protect the people of Sternbild City. Previously the King of Heroes, Kotetsu had started to decline in the competitive Hero TV show, and as a result, his sponsor company was bought out by Apollon Media. Shortly afterward, he is forced by his new sponsor to form the world's first hero team with Barnaby Brooks Jr.

Kotetsu is a also a single father who struggles to balance his job as a hero and his daughter, [[Kaburagi Kaede|Kaede]].

title: big_barda
body:
[b]Big Barda[/b] (also known as [b]Barda Free[/b]) is an anti-superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]].  

She first appeared in Mister Miracle #4 (October 1971), and was created by [[Jack Kirby]]. Barda is very tall and  has superhuman strength and endurance. She is usually seen wearing a [[superhero costume]] consisting of a red cape and a blue and golden [[armor]]ed uniform with a similarly colored helmet. Barda is also armed with an energy firing golden mace. 

In [[real life]] Barda's physical appearance is based on actress "Lainie Kazan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lainie_Kazan , who at the time of the creation of the character had recently appeared topless in [[Playboy]]. 

In 2011, Big Barda was ranked 75th in Comics Buyer's Guide's "100 Sexiest Women in Comics" list.

title: human_furniture
body: A subset of [[BDSM]] fetish where a person pretends to be "[[furniture]]" and allowed the "master" to use them as if they were an inanimate object. Typically involves using them as a "living [[chair]]" by [[sitting_on_person|sitting on them]].

title: human_scabbard
body:
When objects, usually [[weapon|weapons]], are [[drawing_sword|pulled out]] of a person's body without harming them, either magically or by technological means (e.g. the person is a [[cyborg]] with a built-in sheath).

For lack of a better term, this tag also applies to non-human characters.

Not to be confused with [[object insertion]], [[impaled]] or [[stab|stabbed]]; this tag implies that there's not normally an orifice present at that location that could hold the object and no injury was done to the person by the object.

For someone holding an object between their breasts, see [[between breasts]] instead.

h4. Notable examples

* [[sekai wo kakumei suru chikara wo|Shoujo Kakumei Utena's ritual]]
* [[Raiden Shogun]]'s technique

h4. See also

* [[human furniture]]
* [[human shield]]
* [[human weapon]]

title: garo_(series)
body:
Japanese [[tokusatsu]] franchise created by [[Amemiya Keita]]. Later added anime installments to its anthology.

While the locations, time periods, and power mechanics vary from series to series, each revolves around monster hunters known as makai knights. Tasked with tracking and slaying demons known as Horrors, they are each able to summon a mystical suit of armor, with the protagonist typically wielding the titular armor of the golden knight, Garo.

h4. Live Action
h5. Saejima series

title: yuusha_ou_gaogaigar
body:
The eighth series of the [[Yuusha Series]], debuting in 1997.

Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar shares a universe with [[Betterman]]. The original 1997 series is succeeded by [[Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar FINAL]], which is followed by the climactic third part, [[Hakaiou: GaoGaiGar vs. Betterman]]. The titular robot and its iterations have been referenced in broader pop culture, including [[Gunleon]] from [[Super Robot Wars Z1]].

body:
An original character by Bakeneko.

She is a [[mature female|MILF]] [[kitsune]] with [[dark skin]] and an extremely [[large tail]]. Typically depicted with [[closed eyes]] and a [[smile]], but is also sometimes shown with open [[blue eyes]] which [[no pupils|lack pupils]]. She also has [[huge breasts]] and a [[plump|very large frame]]. 

She wears various [[hair ornament|hair ornaments]], the most notable one being a [[magatama]] [[hairclip]]. Often seen accompanied by [[hitodama]].

title: akaitorino_musume_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Japanese: "Daughter of the red bird" (i.e. of Apapane)[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|Racehorse]]. Sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Apapane (racehorse)|]], she is the winner of the 2021 Shuka Sho, rounding up the 2021 Triple Tiara along with [[Sodashi (racehorse)|]] and [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]].

She is infamous for her prosaic but straightfoward name, leading to jokes where her fellow tiaras have similar names ("Daughter of the [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|white thing]]" for Uberleben, "Daughter of the [[Kurofune (racehorse)|black ship]]" or "Daughter of the [[Buchiko (racehorse)|white mottled one]]" for Sodashi).

title: apapane_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the "ʻApapane":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CA%BBApapane], a small red bird from the Hawaiian Islands. Follows her sire's Hawaiian theme naming.[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Salty Bid. Apapane is Japan's third Triple Tiara.

She is [[Akaitorino Musume (racehorse)|]]'s dam.

title: pinyin_commentary

title: circuit_of_the_americas
body: An American [[racetrack]] in [[Texas]], known as [b]COTA[/b] for short. Most well known as the site of [[Formula One]]'s United States Grand Prix, COTA has hosted rounds of many other series as well, currently including [[NASCAR]], [[Moto GP]], [[GT World Challenge America]], and the [[World Endurance Championship]], while the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]], the [[American Le Mans Series]], [[Grand-Am Road Racing]], and the [[IndyCar Series]] held races there in the past.

title: can-am_(motorsports)
body: Officially known as the [b]Canadian-American Challenge Cup[/b], Can-Am was a motorsports series that ran from 1966 to 1989 with races in both the United States and Canada. The series was notable for having minimal regulations for car construction, leading many teams to develop bizarre [[racecar]]s that used extreme aerodynamics or unconventional power sources to maximize performance.

title: british_touring_car_championship
body: A [[racing]] series for [[racecar|touring cars]] in the [[United Kingdom]] that started in 1958.

title: chirico_cuvie
body: Main protagonist of [[Soukou Kihei Votoms]]. Chirico is a [[blue_hair|blue-haired]] Melkian soldier who uncovers a conspiracy related to the PS (Perfect Soldier) Project, and becomes a wanted man for it despite knowing next to nothing. He is a quiet man, almost always seen in orange jumpers, the pilot's suit for the [[Scopedog]].
other_names: キリコ・キュービィー

title: arietta_(tales)
body: A member of the Six God Generals in [[Tales of the Abyss]]. Arietta was raised by Ligers (a type of wolf monster) in the forests until [[Van Grants]] found her and trained her to become Fon Master [[Ion (tales)|]]'s bodyguard. Arietta is a monster tamer who brings creatures into battle with her. She also holds a fierce grudge towards [[Anise Tatlin]] because she feels Anise stole Ion from her. Her seiyuu is [[Yukino Satsuki]].

title: refrain_no_chika_meikyuu_to_majo_no_ryodan
body:
Refrain no Chika Meikyuu to Majo no Ryodan -Coven and Labyrinth of Refrain- is a turn-based role-playing dungeon crawler video game with character designs by Harada Takehito. It was developed and published by Nippon Ichi Software originally for the PlayStation Vita in 2016 and later ported to the PlayStation 4 in 2017 exclusively in Japan.

The player assumes the role of the book Youro Rekitei that is carried by the witch Dronia and her apprentice Luca which is used to magically summon various classes of doll soldiers for use in combat.

h5. Main Characters
* Dronia
* Luca
* Youro Rekitei
* Neld
* Petrone
* Klaus
* Juliette
* Marietta
* Nimmt
* Fritz
* Meili

h5. Doll Soldiers
* Aster Knight
* Shinobushi
* Theatrical Star
* Peer Fortress
* Marginal Maze
* Mad Raptor
* [[Gothic Coppelia]]
* Demon Reaper

h4. See also
* Official site: https://nippon1.jp/consumer/refrain/

body:
A type of Chinese [[hand fan]], they're often somewhat [[transparent fan|transparent]]. It's a common  accessory to accompany [[hanfu]] or [[china dress]], sometimes used to [[covering own mouth|cover one's mouth]].

Not to be confused with an [[uchiwa]]. While both are round fans, a tuanshan is completely round, made with silk instead of paper, and has no hole.

title: rin_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] and Princess Connect! Re:Dive. She is of the [[squirrel girl|beast race]] and a member of the guild Elizabeth Park.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] [[brown hair]] stylized in [[low twintails]], [[small breasts]], and [[purple eyes]], as well as [[squirrel ears]] and a [[squirrel tail]]. She usually wears [[red scrunchie|red]] [[hair scrunchie]]s, [[crop top]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[puffy detached sleeves]], a [[bracelet]], [[puffy shorts|puffy]] [[white shorts]], and a [[red bandana]] with [[jingle bell]]s.

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of hers include:

* [[rin_(ranger)_(princess_connect!)|Ranger Rin]]
* Halloween Rin

[spoiler]Her name in the real world before the events of Re:Dive was [[rin_(real)_(princess_connect!)|Morichika Rin]] (森近鈴).[/spoiler]

She is voiced by [[Koiwai Kotori]].

h4. External Links

* "Princess Connect Re:Dive Wiki: Rin":https://princess-connect.fandom.com/wiki/Rin

She has [[black horns]], [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with [[crossed bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]], [[small breasts]], [[red eyes]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. She wears a [[torn clothes|torn]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[purple dress]], a [[purple gloves|purple]] [[single elbow glove]], a [[single sleeve|single]] [[purple sleeves|purple]] [[detached sleeves|detached sleeve]], [[black pantyhose]], and a [[collar]].

[[official_alternate_costume|Alternate in-game outfits]] of hers include:

title: talons
body:
The sharp, hooked [[claws]] at the end of the toes of predator avians. Birds have one talon on every toe, and they may differ in overall shape, curvature and thickness. 

Doves don't have a use for talons as they do not hunt to feed themselves; doves have claws, but no talons.

[[harpy|Harpies]] are commonly depicted with them.

h4. See also

* [[digitigrade]]

* "Wikipedia: Talons (anatomy)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talon_(anatomy)]

title: wacky_races
body:
Wacky Races is an animated television series produced by Hanna-Barbera. The series features 11 different cars racing against each other in various road rallies throughout North America, with each driver hoping to win the title of the "World's Wackiest Racer." Wacky Races ran on CBS from September 14, 1968, to January 4, 1969. Seventeen episodes were produced, with each episode featuring two different races.

The cartoon had an unusually large number of regular characters, with twenty-three people and animals spread among the 11 race cars, plus the unseen (and never identified) race announcer. Two spinoffs were made in the form of 1969's The Perils of Penelope Pitstop, and Dastardly and Muttley in Their Flying Machines.

h4. See also

* "Wacky Races":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wacky_Races on Wikipedia

title: milestone_celebration
body:
An image drawn by an artist to celebrate hitting certain milestones, such as the number of followers on Pixiv, Twitter, etc, or the number of hits on their personal website.

The number of followers is usually displayed in the background, shown with [[finger counting]], on a [[holding sign|sign a character is holding]], or [[body writing|written on a character's body]].

A text [[thank you|thanking their viewers, subscribers, followers, etc. for helping them to reach the milestone]] is very often part of such an image.

h4. See also

* [[announcement celebration]]
* [[ending celebration]]
* [[release celebration]]
* [[thank you]]
* [[congratulations]]

title: physalis_(mugen)
body:
An edit of [[Alice Margatroid]] made by Lates for [[M.U.G.E.N]].
Her moveset is directly inspired from [[Psyqhical]].
Not to be confused with [[Nirvana (mugen)|]], Physalis wears black, has brown hair and blue eyes.

title: psyqhical
body:
A fan-made [[The King of Fighters]] character.

Psyqhical was created for the [[M.U.G.E.N]] fangame [i]The King of Fighters Memorial[/i], where he serves as the right-hand man of [[Gustav Munchausen]].

Appearance-wise, Psyqhical is very obviously a sprite edit of [[Duo Lon]]. In-game, however, he is absurdly overpowered; making use of many infinite priority attacks.

Psyqhical has resulted in many edited characters M.U.G.E.N. that are based off of him in some manner; [[Physalis (mugen)|]] ([[Alice Margatroid]]) is one such edit.

title: uzen_kyouka
body:
The main female protagonist of [[Mato Seihei no Slave]].

The Anti-Demon Corps' 7th division commander. Kyouka serves as the "master" to [[Wakura Yuuki]] whose ability allows her to enslave anyone draw out strength from any living beings through submission. Yuuki would eventually become her "slave," granting him powerful abilities upon submission via [[licking]] her fingers.

This ability comes at a price, whenever her slaves have done their task she assigns to, Kyouka would often "reward" them based on their inner desires. In Yuuki's case, his "reward" would be something far more [[pervert|salacious]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair]] and [[pink eyes]] with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[headgear]], [[peaked cap]], [[black jacket|black]] [[military uniform]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] and [[thigh boots]]. She is often seen carrying a [[sword]].

title: wakura_yuuki
body:
The titular main protagonist of [[Mato Seihei no Slave]].

He serves as the dorm manager for the Anti-Demon Corps. He was previously a third-year high school student, but enters the Anti-Demon Corps after entering a gate that appeared. During the events of the series, he would eventually become the slave of [[Uzen Kyouka]], whose ability allows him to transform into a beast that grants him superhuman capabilities.

He is a well-built young man with [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

title: through_medium
body:
Someone or something goes through the medium they are presented in, such a coming out of a page. This may be a [[fourth wall]] break, but does not have to be -- the medium being passed through may be an object depicted in the work, rather than being the work itself. For tagging purposes this also includes things that are not a typically considered a medium on their own, such as a coming out of a screen. This also includes reaching "into" the medium, eg post #2130515.

* [[fourth wall]]

title: kaiji
body:
[[Fukumoto Nobuyuki]]'s gambling manga and anime series, also called [i]Ultimate Survivor Kaiji[/i]. 

The titular main character, [[Itou Kaiji]], accidentally takes on the debts of a friend, and, lacking any other job because of the Japanese recession, is forced into perpetual poverty and desperate gambling schemes to stay one step ahead of the Yakuza collection enforcers. Known and referenced in other works for the likes of their underground labor camps where gambling losers wind up working off their debts in Hellish conditions.

title: deus_ex
body:
[b]Deus Ex[/b] is a series of [[cyberpunk]] themed action role-playing [[video game]]s, consisting of six games: [[Deus Ex (2000)]], Deus Ex: Invisible War (2003), [[Deus Ex: Human Revolution]] (2011),  Deus Ex: The Fall (2013), Deus Ex Go (2016) and [[Deus Ex: Mankind Divided]] (2016).

While the games have distinct settings and story lines, they all explore the methods used by the world's elite to control and manipulate society. 

Main characters in the series possess artificially acquired superhuman abilities which the third game calls [[cyborg|Human Augmentation]].

h4. See also

* [[JC Denton]]
* [[Adam Jensen]]

title: hex_maniac_(pokemon_rse)
body:
[[Hex Maniac (pokemon)|]]'s first debut in [i][[pokemon_rse|RSE]][/i], as women wearing a purple [[witch hat]], a purple  [[cape]], black [[shorts]], and purple [[shoes]]. They appear to be holding a [[crystal ball]].

They have [[long hair]], which appears black at the top but is otherwise brown. They have [[blank eyes]] in the Japanese games. This was altered in the English and other international releases, where they have normal black eyes.

title: idoly_pride
body:
[[IDOLY PRIDE]] is a Japanese idol multimedia project with two manga series, an anime that aired in January 2021, and a live-service gacha game with both Japanese and Global versions. Original character designs were created by the circle [[QP:flapper]], and its original [[4koma]] series is authored by [[Musshu (omu001)|]].

Its story details a small talent agency founded in the fictitious Hoshimi City, Japan called Hoshimi Productions that manages five idol groups: [[Sunny Peace (idoly Pride)|]], [[Tsuki no Tempest (idoly Pride)|]], [[TRINITYAiLE (idoly pride)|]], [[LizNoir (idoly pride)|]], and [[IIIX (idoly pride)|]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia - Idoly Pride":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idoly_Pride]

title: ryuuguu_rena
body:
A character in [[Higurashi no Naku Koro Ni]]. She is voiced by [[Nakahara Mai]].

She has a hobby for collecting and obsessing over cute things, as well as treasure hunting. Her catchphrase "I want to [[take it home]] with me!" referes to her tendency to collect anything she deems cute.

Although gentle and friendly, she suffered from a mental disease after her mother has left her. This led into her often underwent a stage of [[crazy|psychopath]]ic rampage against everyone.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] with [[bangs]]. Her school attire consists of a [[serafuku]] with a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]]. Her casual attire consists of a [[white dress]], [[purple bow]], [[black thighhighs]], and a [[white headwear|white]] [[hat]]. She also often wields a distinctive [[machete]] during rampage.

title: maebara_keiichi
body:
A character in [[Higurashi no Naku Koro Ni]]. Voiced by [[Hoshi Souichirou]].

He recently moves to Hinamizawa after an array of unfortunate events in his hometown.  Hoping for a fresh start quickly befriending classmates in the Game Club. 

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]].

His school attire consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[red shirt]] underneath and [[black pants]].

His casual attire consists of a [[black shirt]], [[red vest]], and [[green shorts]].

His mother is [[Maebara Aiko]].

title: tsumihoroboshi-hen
body:
The sixth story arc of [[Higurashi no Naku Koro ni]]. The English title is the "Atonement Chapter". Its events correspond with the [[Watanagashi-hen]] arc.

The manga adaptation is written by [[Ryuukishi07]] and drawn by [[Suzuragi Karin]]. The light novel has art drawn by [[Tomohi]].

title: katori_yuutarou
body:
The protagonist of sorts of [[Taiyou no Yuusha Fighbird]], and de facto core of the [[Fighbird | titular Brave]]. Katori is an alien who, upon coming into contact with Earth, decides to protect it as part of the Space Police Force.

As an extraterrestrial being, Katori's lack of knowledge on Earth's living beings leads him to [[is_this_a_pigeon_(meme)|mistake a butterfly for a pigeon]], sparking a [[meme]].

title: himuro_ayame
body:
Himuro Ayame is one of the two main characters of all incarnations of [[rikei ga koi ni ochita no de shoumeishitemita|Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shōmei Shite Mita]]. She is a 1st-year post-graduate science and technology researcher at Saitama University. Having to fallen in love with [[Yukimura Shinya]] (Ayame's academic rival), she embarks on a mathematical and logical journey with him to prove this love when he demands such proof. 

Appearance: [[light purple hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[ponytail]]
Wears [[glasses]], [[lab coat]], [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]]

He has short [[grey hair]] with short [[bangs]], and [[brown eyes]].  His character sheet depicts him wearing a [[black shirt|black]] [[dress shirt|dress]] [[shirt]] under a [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]], [[black pants]], [[black gloves|black]] [[gloves]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[shoes]]. He has [[multiple earrings|multiple]] [[earrings]] in each ear, including an [[industrial piercing]].

title: sekia_hills_circuit
body:
Sekia Hills was a Japanese [[racetrack]] specifically designed for drifting, notable for being one of the main recurring tracks  for [[D1 Grand Prix]] and being featured in many Japanese drifting videos in the 90s and early 00s.

The track was closed in 2012, and the land it was on has since been converted into a solar energy farm.

title: kurumada_blast-off
body:
When a character is sent flying away by a powerful attack in a manner frequently seen in the works of [[Kurumada Masami]]. Occurs often in the aftermath of [[Saint Seiya]] finishing moves, as well as uppercuts in [[Ring ni Kakero]]. The victim is usually depicted with all limbs splayed and their head lolling back as they are flung away from the point of impact. 

This is often parodied in various works.

title: amane_tsukuyo_(swimsuit_ver.)
body:
A [[official alternate costume|playable variant]] of [[Amane Tsukuyo]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She [[matching outfits|matches]] this costume with her [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] [[Amane Tsukasa]].

Her [[very long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] is tied into a [[single braid|single]] [[braided ponytail]] with a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow|bow]] and decorated with a [[shell hair ornament|shell]], [[yellow flower|yellow]] [[plumeria]] [[hair flower|flowers]] and [[starfish hair ornament|starfish]]. She has [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[red eyes]].

She wears a [[black choker|black]] [[choker]] with a [[crescent]] [[pendant choker|pendant]], a [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[blue bikini]] with a [[treble clef]], a [[halterneck]] and a [[bikini skirt|skirt-like bottom]] with a [[white ribbon|white]] [[ribbon]], a [[single wristcuff|single]] [[frilled cuffs|frilled cuff]], a [[red gemstone|red]] [[hand jewel]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[asymmetrical footwear|asymmetrical]] ([[uneven footwear|uneven]]) [[sandals]].

title: korn_(band)
body:
An American "nu metal":[/pools/6818] band from Bakersfield, [[California]], [[United States]]. Formed in 1993, the band is notable for pioneering the nu metal genre and bringing it into the mainstream.

[b]Korn[/b]'s current lineup: 
* James "Munky" Shaffer (guitar)
* Reginald "Fieldy" Arvizu (bass)
* Brian "Head" Welch (guitar, backing vocals)
* Jonathan Davis (lead vocals, bagpipes)
* Ray Luzier (drums); replacing the band's first drummer David Silveria in 2007.

h4. External links
* "Official Website":https://kornofficial.com/
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korn
* "YouTube Channel":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jRGrNDV2mKc

body:
[i]Driven by the warm weather, he goes for a walk with his sketchbook in one hand.
However, he'll always take a nap whenever he returns. He likes soft lawns and swings.[/i]

A [[cat boy]] with [[green hair]] from Yokohama, Japan. Loves to climb up and sleep in trees. Carries a [[sketchbook]] which he is often seen [[drawing (action)|]] in.

Romantically interested in [[Sumire (Pop'n Music)|]].

title: artist_glove
body:
An artist glove is a  [[gloves|glove]] that [[partially fingerless gloves|only covers the pinky and ring finger]] while leaving the middle finger, index finger, and thumb free to manipulate a [[pen]], [[pencil]], or [[stylus]] when [[drawing (action)|]]. These gloves work to prevent smudging while drawing on traditional media and reduce friction and grease when drawing on a [[drawing tablet]]. Also known as an anti-fouling artist glove, smudge protector, and two finger drawing glove.

Typically worn only on the drawing hand and not worn as a set.

title: takaramonozu
body:
[i](Lit. "Treasures")[/i]

A single performed by [i]μ's[/i] from [i][[Love Live!]][/i]. It first appeared as a special song for [i][[Love Live! School Idol Festival]][/i] during its year since launch.

The costume set for this song are [[cheerleader]] outfits. Each girl's color schemes are based on their image colors. Along with [[ pom pom (cheerleading)|cheerleading pom poms]], their primary appearance consist of short [[tank top]]s or [[strapless shirt]]s with [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]]s while exposing their [[midriff]]. Their legwears are at [[thighhighs|thigh length]] and wear [[inline skates|inline]] [[roller skates]] as their footwear.

The outfits have been previously exclusive to [i]μ's[/i], but ever since [i]Aqours'[/i] and [i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] were introduced into the game, the latter girls have received their own versions of the outfits as well.

Aquors' cheer uniforms reappeared in [i][[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]][/i] as "Happiness Cheerleader."

She wears a [[checkered]] [[kimono]] and an [[apron]] with "[[character name|Kosuzu]]" [[clothes writing|written]] in romaji and "Suzunaan" (鈴奈庵) in kanji on the front, has [[red eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[two side up]] (or [[twintails]]) adorned with [[hair bell|bells]]. body:
Ada Wong is a recurring character appearing in the [[Resident Evil]] video game series. A mysterious American woman of Asian descent, Ada is a cunning and formidable secret agent, typically served as the main anti-hero of the series and an (implied) love interest of [[Leon S. Kennedy]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] usually stylized in a [[bob cut]]. She is usually depicted wearing a [[red dress]], [[black choker]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], [[bracelet]]s, and a [[wristwatch]]. In [[Resident Evil 6]], she wears a [[red jacket]] and [[black pants]]. In [[Resident Evil 4 (remake)]], she wears a [[red sweater|red]] [[turtleneck sweater|turtleneck]] [[sweater dress]].

title: trireme
body:
A trireme was an ancient vessel and a type of galley that was used by the ancient maritime civilizations of the Mediterranean Sea, especially the Phoenicians, ancient [[Greece|Greeks]] and [[roman empire|Romans]].

The trireme derives its name from its three rows of oars, manned with one man per oar. The early trireme was a development of the penteconter, an ancient warship with a single row of 25 oars on each side (i.e., a single-banked boat), and of the bireme, a warship with two banks of oars, of Phoenician origin. The word dieres does not appear until the Roman period. AAs a ship, it was fast and agile and was the dominant warship in the Mediterranean from the 7th to the 4th centuries BC, after which it was largely superseded by the larger quadriremes and quinqueremes. Triremes played a vital role in the Persian Wars, the creation of the Athenian maritime empire and its downfall during the Peloponnesian War.

Medieval and early modern galleys with three files of oarsmen per side are sometimes referred to as triremes.

title: aek-971
body:
The [b]AK-47[/b] ([b]А[/b]втомат [b]е[/b]диный [b]К[/b]окшарова 971) is a selective fire 5.45×39mm  [b][[assault rifle]][/b] of [[Soviet]] origin, that was developed at the Kovrov Mechanical Plant (KMZ) by chief designer [[Stanislav Ivanovich Koksharov]]. 

The AEK-971 is based on previous [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] rifles in internal design and layout, but features a Balanced Automatics Recoil System (BARS) that enhances the traditional Kalashnikov long stroke gas piston operating system by reducing the negative effects of recoil. The AEK-971's iron sights features an adjustable notched rear tangent rear sight calibrated in 100 m (109 yd) increments from 100 to 1,000 m (109 to 1,094 yd) and a hooded front post. Each AEK assault rifle is fitted with a Warsaw Pact side-rail bracket for mounting optics. It is fed through [[AK-74]], [[RPK-74]] pattern 5.45×39mm 30-round or larger box magazines.

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: AK-47":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AEK-971

title: flock
body:
Multiple birds (near always the same species) behaving as a group. Distinct from [[too_many_birds]] in that the birds must be a grouping in some way (Eg, being clustered together or flying together), for instance a pet store featuring countless cages with a few birds each or a series of taxidermy animals would be not count as flock but could be too_many_birds.


[[Too_many_birds]] not [[flock]]: post #6692857 post #6949868 post #114802
[[Flock]] and [[too_many_birds]]: post #6709824 post #5779985 post #6626571 post #6237359

In cases where a character is surrounded by birds that appear to have been startled post #6244855 it is generally safe to tag flock.

title: ruan
body:
The [b]Ruan[/b] (阮) traditional Chinese plucked string musical instrument. It is very similar to a [[pipa (instrument)|pipa]], being a lute with a fretted neck, a circular body, and four strings., but it has a round circle, rather than pear, shaped base.

In classical Chinese from [[Han dynasty|Han]] to [[Tang dynasty|Tang]], pipa referred to any plucked-string instrument.  It is believed that ruan may have been descended from an instrument called xiantao (弦鼗) which was constructed by labourers on the [[Great Wall of China]] during the late [[Qin dynasty]] (hence the name Qin pipa) using strings stretched over a pellet drum. During the reign of [[Wu Zetian|Empress Wu Zetian]] (about 684–704 AD), a copper instrument that looked like the Qin pipa was discovered in an ancient tomb in Sichuan. Since Ruan Xian was an expert and famous in playing an instrument that looked like the Qin pipa, the instrument was named after him as ruanxian (阮咸) when the copper Qin pipa was found. Today it is shortened to ruan.

title: mian_guan
body:
A type of headwear designed for kings and emperors of ancient China, Japan, Korea and Vietnam. Characterized by a square lacquered board placed on top of the headgear, with strands of jade beads draping from the two ends, which represent the rank of the wearer.

Originating in [[Chinese empire|China]], the mianguan was worn by the emperor, his ministers, and aristocrats. The mianguan was the most expensive [[Chinese Clothes|Chinese headware]], reserved for important sacrificial events. Regulations on its shape and its making were issued under the [[Han dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] and applied in the succeeding dynasties only to be ended at the fall of the [[Ming dynasty]] in the 16th century AD.

In Japan, emperors and nobles wore gold, silver, and gilt-bronze crowns, influenced by the Korean peninsula, from the Kofun period (mid 3rd century-7th century). In the 8th century, influenced by the Chinese mianguan, the unique benkan was born, a metal crown with chains and a sun-shaped ornament at the top. It is also worn in Vietnam, and the monarchs of the [[Joseon dynasty]] also wore an equivalent crown, the myeonlyugwan. 

h4.External links

* "Photo (the Dingling Museum of the Ming Tombs)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chinese_Imperial_Mian,_Dingling.jpg]
* "A list of Guan, Jin, and other headwear":https://torguqin.wordpress.com/hanfu/hanfu-history/list/

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

Created from [[X_(Mega_Man)|]]'s DNA data for the purpose of helping restore the Earth for human habitation. Fights using twin energy blades and the ability to control wind and lightning.

body:
[[Furutaka (Kancolle)|]]'s kai ni form.

On her second remodel, she now wears a [[bodysuit]] covering her torso, abdomen, hip, and ends at her shoulders and mid-thighs. She also wears a [[single elbow glove]] on her right arm and her single thighhigh has changed side. Her ship parts are now even bulkier, covering more of her right arm, and are held in place with a chain, all resembling the bow of a ship. The gear on her left leg has been streamlined and now features a catapult. She now wears actual shoes instead of the previous metal booties. Kako's [[hairclip|screw hairclips]] have been added. Her left eye is now [[glowing_eye|glowing]] brightly, with a spark being added to emphasize the effect.

title: kneeless_mermaid
body:
A [[mermaid]] or [[merman]] with a tail that more closely resembles a marine animal's hind half (curving smoothly like vertebrae in a tail or spine), as opposed to designs that resemble legs wrapped in scales (bent sharply in the middle, like the knees in a leg). Especially if the tail fins are also correct for the type of sea creature (vertical for fish; horizontal for sea mammals). 

In addition to the entry above, only use this tag when the merperson's lower body is clearly visible.

Unlike other trotters, Numby is differentiated by its red ribbon, gold trimming, gradient flaps, and smaller size, as opposed to the colorless and bigger trotters. Can passively aid the player in finding treasures.

title: morichika_rinnosuke
body:
A half-human, half-youkai [[merchant]], and one of the only few named male characters in [[Touhou]].

He runs [[Kourindou]], an antiques shop near the [[Forest of Magic]] stocked with items found in the human world outside [[Gensokyo]], sometimes supplied by [[Yakumo Yukari|Yukari]]. [[Hakurei Reimu|Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa|Marisa]] often visit him, but rarely as customers.

He recently got a small [[robot dog]] pet, which he named [[Laika (touhou)|Laika]].

[[Doujinshi]] sometimes portray him either as a lecherous [[pervert]] running around wearing only a [[fundoshi]] or as an extremely [[muscular male]] with power almost equal to the rest of the cast - dubbed [[MANnosuke]].

He makes a cameo in the background of the [[human village (touhou)|Human Village]] stage in [i][[Hopeless Masquerade]][/i], his first official in-game appearance of any kind.

h4. See also

* [[Mannosuke]]
* [[Kourindou]]
* pool #1133: The Sad Truth of Gensokyo

h4. External links

body:

title: doyagao
body:
Doya-gao (ドヤ顔) is a facial expression conveying a self-satisfied, cocky, or [[smug]] attitude. To enhance the comedy effect, one may use this expression on a character who is overly proud of something they failed at, or that they have no reason to be proud of.

Doya probably comes from Kansai Japanese "Dou ya?" meaning asking someone "How about that?" or "How well am I doing?". The phrase carries an inside meaning of "I looked cool just now, didn't I?"

A few trademarks of doyagao are a cocky expression, featuring a tight [[closed mouth|closed-lip]] [[smile]], [[closed eyes|closed]] or [[sparkling eyes]], [[v-shaped eyebrows]], and a proud [[puff of air|huff]], along with [[hands on own hips|hands on one's hips]] or chest, and a general air of "I totally nailed it just now", when the character didn't nail it at all.

h4. See also

* [[smirk]]
* [[smug]]
* [[troll face]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

h4. External links

* "NicoNicoPedia: どや顔":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%81%A9%E3%82%84%E9%A1%94
* "Pixipedia: どや顔":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%A9%E3%82%84%E9%A1%94
* "PixiVision article":https://www.pixivision.net/en/a/2807

body:
[i][b]Macross Δ[/b][/i] (マクロスΔ [i]Makurosu Deruta[/i], pronounced [i][b]Macross Delta[/b][/i]) is a 2016 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] animated television series set in the [[MACROSS]] universe created by [[Kawamori Shouji]]. 

The story takes place in the year 2067, 8 years after the events of [[Macross Frontier]]. 

The weekly series premiered on Tokyo MX on April 3, 2016. It lasted 26 episodes, and two movies were made based on the series ([[Macross Delta: gekijou no Walkure|Gekijou no Walkure]] and [[Macross delta: zettai live!!!!!!|Zettai Live!!!!!!]]).

body:

A 10th dan [[karate]] grandmaster and head of the Shinshinkai school of karate. Doppo is an expert martial artist who takes pride in his strength, yet also humble enough to acknowledged his weakness when being bested in a fight. [[Orochi Katsumi]] is his adopted son.

He loses his right eye after a fight with [[Hanma Yujiro]], though he has gained the respect from Yujiro for his prowess and determination to improve himself and the two later become friends. Doppo are one of the fighters who played a large part in the development of Yujiro's son [[Hanma Baki|Baki]] to become "The Strongest Creature on Earth".

title: pp-19-01_vityaz
body:
PP-19-01 (also known as [b]Vityaz SN[/b]) is a closed-bolt, blowback, 9×19mm Parabellum [b][[submachine gun]][/b] developed in 2004 by [b]Russian[/b] small arms manufacturer Izhmash ("Kalashnikov Concern":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalashnikov_Concern]). It is heavily based on the [b]AK platform[/b] and offers a high degree of parts commonality with the [[AK-74]]. The [[gun]] is directly developed from the [[PP-19 Bizon]]. "Vityaz" (витязь) is [[russian text|Russian]] word for "[[knight]]".

The weapon is fed from a standard 30-round box [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] and comes with a fastening device that joins two magazines together. It can fire high-pressure "7N31":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/9×19mm_Parabellum#Russian_military_overpressure_variants] [[ammunition|round]] that can penetrate soft [[body armor|body armour]].

title: gakkou_no_kaidan_(anime)
body:
[b]Gakkou no Kaidan[/b] ([i]School Ghost Stories[/i] in English) is a 2000 paranormal anime series, based on the childrens' books of the same name by Toru Tsunemitsu. Produced by Aniplex, made by Studio Pierrot and airing on Fuji TV, the show was an initial success in Japan, albeit with little merchandising and lackluster reruns. Animax would produce an English-language dub entitled '[i]Ghost at School[/i]' in 2004 for airing in other Asian markets. ADV Films would gain the rights for its English dub in native English markets a year later, with Aniplex only listing three criteria for the dub to meet in its contract:

1. Do not change the names of any characters, including the ghosts. 
2. Do not change the way any ghost is killed, as it is based on Japanese folklore. 
3. Do not change the core meaning of any episode.

The resulting dub, known as [b]Ghost Stories[/b], would turn the series into a comedic self-parody, dramatically changing almost all of the characters' personalities, while otherwise roughly following the criteria listed. ADV's new, dark-comedy version turned out to be a hit, and the show took on a new international cult following, far overshadowing the original series and the first dub. Its success was such that it even led to misinformation surrounding the success of the series in Japan proper.

h4. Characters

* [[Miyanoshita Satsuki]]
* [[Koigakubo Momoko]]
* [[Aoyama Hajime]]
* [[Kakinoki Reo]]
* [[Miyanoshita Keiichirou]]
* [[Amanojaku (gakkou no kaidan)|]]
* [[Miyanoshita Kayako]]

title: imagawayaki
body:
[b]Imagawayaki[/b] (今川焼き) is a Japanese [[dessert]] often found at Japanese [[festival]]s as well as outside Japan. It is made of batter in a special pan (similar to a [[waffle]] iron but without the honeycomb pattern), and filled with sweet azuki [[red bean paste]], although it is becoming increasingly popular to use a wider variety of fillings such as vanilla [[custard]], fruit custards/preserves, curry, various meats, vegetables, potatoes, or mayonnaise. Imagawayaki are similar to [[Dorayaki]], but the latter are two separate pancakes sandwiched around the filling after cooking, and are often served cold.

Imagawayaki began to be sold near the Kanda Imagawabashi bridge during An'ei years (1772–1781) in the Edo period. The name of Imagawayaki originates from this time.

(From Wikipedia)

The Imagawayaki is famous for its numerous names, regional and store brands, "Imagawayaki" even just being the primary name in the Kantō region. The main joke involving this treat is really just pointing out it has many names, making a new name for it, or identifying a character's native region by how they name it. The only name that reached any sort of consensus is "[b]Baked Mochocho[/b]" and it's only because it's a ridiculous joke name.

h4. Further information

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imagawayaki

title: bfg_9000
body:
The [b]BFG 9000[/b], short for [b]Blast Field Generator 9000[/b] ([b]Bio Force Gun version 3.14[/b] in the 2005 movie), or more commonly known as the [b]Big Fucking Gun 9000[/b], is a weapon featured consistently throughout the [[Doom (series)|]] games. 

It is [[Doomguy]]'s most powerful weapon, firing a large green energy ball that obliterates anything it touches and emits tracers for extra damage.

In the original Doom series, the BFG works in an unintuitive way. When the trigger is pulled, there is a slight delay before a large green plasma ball is ejected. After the green ball hits any object, there is another slight delay before 40 invisible tracers are emitted from the player's body in a cone shape, like a shotgun blast, in the same direction the plasma ball was originally fired. The green ball itself deals significant damage to enemies when hit, but most of the potential damage from a BFG shot is from the tracers. Sufficiently skilled players can take advantage of this and consistently kill a [[Cyberdemon]], a boss monster with the most health in the game, in two BFG shots. This requires getting very close at the right times to maximize the number of tracers hitting the enemy, which is risky because the cyberdemon's rocket launcher is extremely damaging, guaranteed to one-shot players who have no armor or extra health.

h4. Designs
* Doom, Doom II
* Doom 64
* Quake II (BFG 10000)
* Quake III Arena (BFG 10000)
* Doom 3
* Doom (2005 movie)
* Doom 2016, Doom Eternal

h4. See also
* [[Doom (series)]]
* [[BFG 10000 (Doom Eternal)|]]

h4. External links
* "Doom Wiki - BFG 9000":https://doomwiki.org/wiki/BFG9000

title: nissan_skyline_r34
body:
The tenth generation of the [[Nissan Skyline]], produced from 1998 to 2000. Arguably one of the most recognizable iterations of the car.

This was the final Skyline generation to have a [[nissan skyline gt-r|GT-R]] variant. The GT-R badge would again be put on hiatus until 2009, when Nissan released the [[Nissan GT-R]] as a dedicated supercar and successor to the Skyline GT-R line.

The R34 had several appearances in popular media. In several [[Fast & Furious]] films it is driven by [[Brian O'Connor]], in [[Initial D]] it is driven by Hoshino Kozo, and in [[Wangan Midnight]] two R34s are driven by Yamamoto Kazuhiko and Goto Gen. It also remains a staple of many racing game rosters to this day, having also been the cover car for multiple [[Need for Speed]] games - namely [[Need for speed: underground|Underground]] and Payback.

title: toyota_supra_mk_iv
body:
The fourth generation of the [[Toyota Supra]], produced from 1993 to 2002. Easily the most iconic of the Supra models, the Mk IV is widely considered one of the best cars ever produced by [[Toyota]], and is often the most expensive 90s JDM halo car in the secondhand market.

The Mk IV Supra is most well known for it's appearance in the first [[Fast & Furious]] film, where it is the main car driven by Brian O'Conner.

His speeches about family would later inspire the [[but family is stronger (meme)|"but family is stronger" meme]].

title: furious_7
body:
The 7th installment in [[Fast & Furious]] saga, released in 2015. This was the last entry to feature [[Brian O'Connor]] due to Paul Walker's death, with the character being sent off in the often-referenced [[The Last Ride (furious 7)|]] scene.

The film is not only notable for it's tribute to Walker, but also for extremely over-the-top stunts (including skydiving cars and making a [[W Motors Lykan HyperSport|Lykan HyperSport]] jump between [[skyscraper]]s), which far outdid any of the previous action scenes in the series.

This entry is known as [b]Wild Speed Sky Mission[/b] in Japan.

The most notable car from the film is the Flip Car, a custom-built vehicle used by Shaw in the final chase scene.

This entry is known as [b]Wild Speed Euro Mission[/b] in Japan.

title: fast_five
body:
The fifth entry in [[Fast & Furious]] saga, released in 2011. The film follows [[Dominic Toretto|Dom]] and his crew in [[Brazil]], as they stage a heist against a powerful drug lord.

Fast Five is notably regarded as a "transitional entry" in the series, as it is the first one to fully embrace the action and heist genre that the would become the series' standard going forward.

This entry is known as [b]Wild Speed Mega Max[/b] in Japan.

Particularly notable cars featured in this entry include Brian's [[Mitsubishi Eclipse]] and [[Toyota Supra Mk IV]], and [[Dominic Toretto|Dom]]'s [[Dodge Charger]].

title: stunner
body:
A wrestling move in which an attacker reaches behind and grabs the head of an opponent, just before the attacker drops to a seated position causing the opponent's jaw to slam into the attacker's shoulder (a seated three-quarter facelock jawbreaker maneuver). The free hand is sometimes used to hold the top of the head.

Made famous by Stone Cold Steve Austin, and named for his Stone Cold Stunner finisher. Though Austin popularized the Stunner, it is actually innovated by ECW wrestler Mikey Whipwreck who called it the [i]Whipper-Snapper[/i]. Other users of the Stunner include [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] wrestler Willie Mack and [[WWE]] wrestlers [[Kevin Owens]] and Ember Moon (who uses a a diving corkscrew variant which she calls the [i]Eclipse[/i]). [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Athena uses a diving corkscrew variant which she calls the [i]O-Face[/i] and the [I]Eclipse[/I] in WWE.

h4. See Also:

* "Wikipedia Article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stunner_%28professional_wrestling%29
* [[wrestling]]
* [[suplex]]
other_names: ストーンコールドスタナー

title: octopus_hold
body:
Also known as the [b]Octopus Stretch[/b] and in Japanese, the [I]Manji-Gatame[/I], it is a [[submission hold]] where the wrestler stands behind the opponent and hooks a leg over the opponent's opposite leg. The wrestler then forces the opponent to one side, traps one of the opponent's arms with their own arm and drapes their free leg over the neck of the opponent, forcing it downward. This elevates the wrestler and places all the weight of the wrestler on the opponent. The wrestler has one arm free, which can be used for balance. 

It was invented by the late Japanese wrestling legend [[Antonio Inoki]]. Some known users of this hold are retired [[WWE]] wrestler [[AJ Lee]] (who called her version as the [I]Black Widow[/I]), [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] and [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler Shibata Katsuyori, and [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] wrestler Jonathan Gresham. New Japan Pro Wrestling wrestler [[Zack Sabre Jr.]] uses multiple variations of the hold and the late [[World Wonder Ring Stardom]] wrestler [[Kimura Hana]] used a grounded variation that she called as the [I]Hydrangea[/I].

title: lariat
body:
In wrestling, a lariat is when an attacking wrestler runs towards an opponent, wraps his arm around their upper chest and neck and then forces them to the ground. This move is similar to a clothesline, the difference being that in a [[clotheslining|clothesline]] the wrestler's arm is kept straight to the side of the wrestler during the move, while in the lariat the wrestler strikes their opponent with his arm.

There are multiple variants of lariat:

1) Northern Lariat or Enzui Lariat: A lariat to the back of the opponent's neck and shoulders. Used by [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]] alumnus and current [[WWE]] superstar Robert Roode.

2) Burning Lariat or Short Range Lariat: A lariat where the wrestler doesn't run but simply strikes the opponent while standing next to him. The wrestler can also hold the opponent's head up before performing the lariat with his other arm. The Burning Lariat is a common variant among Japanese wrestlers, with retired Japanese wrestler Kobashi Kenta among of the users of this variation. 

3) Short-arm Lariat: A variation where the wrestler grabs one of the opponent's wrists with his hand and pulls the opponent closer, striking him with the lariat with his other arm. [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] wrestler [[Okada Kazuchika]]'s [[Rainmaker (wrestling)|Rainmaker]] finishing move is a variation of this, where he holds his opponent in a ripcord position then spins him out to hit the short-arm lariat.

4) Discus Lariat: The wrestler spins in place before he hits the lariat. Used by the late [[All Elite Wrestling]] wrestler/WWE alumnus Mr. Brodie Lee (a.k.a. Luke Harper)

Typically, a lariat is used as a finishing move while the clothesline is simply a basic strike attack. The main difference aside from the mechanics of the movement is the stiffness. Lariats are essentially a very stiff clothesline used as a finisher rather than a basic strike.

title: calf_slicer
body: Also known as a [i]Calf Crusher[/i], it is a compression-type [[submission hold]] that involves pressing the calf and/or thigh muscle into one of the bones in the leg. It can be applied by inserting an arm or leg in the backside of the knee, and flexing the opponent's leg to apply pressure to the muscles surrounding the fulcrum. Generally, the direction of the shin in the leg acting as a fulcrum will determine where the larger part of the pressure will go. Such calf slicers can be used as effective [[leg lock|leg locks]] to the knee through a separating and elongating motion. The calf slicer is listed as a banned technique in the lower levels of some major Brazilian jiu-jitsu competitions. [[WWE]] Wrestler [[AJ Styles]] uses this as one of his finishers, calling it the [i]Calf Killer[/i] in [[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] and [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling|TNA]] and the [i]Calf Crusher[/i] in WWE.

A voicebank for [[cevio|CeVIO AI]] and [[Synthesizer V]], developed by ZAN-SHIN Co., Ltd. and distributed by Internet Co.

She is officially illustrated by [[yoshida iyo]] and voiced by cosplayer "しらゆき":[https://shirayukimiku.com/] (Shirayuki).

She has [[pink hair]] with a [[single side bun]] and [[side braid]]. She wears a [[school uniform]] for her talking voicebank and a [[kimono]] for her singing voicebank. She is the younger sister of [[Vocaloid]] [[CUL]].

title: fast_&_furious
body:
A [[car]]-focused American action movie series that heavily features street racing, chase scenes, and vehicular action sequences. The series notoriously gets more and more ridiculous with each entry, moving further away from the grounded street racing featured in earlier films to heist and espionage plots with over-the-top stunts that usually involve [[sports car]]s performing physically impossible feats.

Known as the [b]Wild Speed[/b] series in Japan.

h4. Characters
* [[Brian O'Connor]]
* [[Dominic Toretto]] (played by [[Vin Diesel]])
* [[Han Lue]]
* [[Letty Ortiz]]
* [[Lucas Hobbs]] (played by [[The Rock (dwayne Johnson)|]])
* [[Owen Shaw]] (played by [[Jason Statham]])
* [[Sean Boswell]]
* [[Suki (2 fast 2 furious)|]]

h4. Main Saga Entries
* [[The Fast and the Furious 1|The Fast and the Furious]] (2001)
* [[2 Fast 2 Furious]] (2003)
* [[The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift]] (2006)
* [[Fast & Furious (2009)|]] (2009)
* [[Fast Five]] (2011)
* [[Fast & Furious 6]] (2013)
* [[Furious 7]] (2015)
* The Fate of the Furious (2017)
* F9 (2021)

h4. Spinoffs 
* [[Hobbs & Shaw]] (2019)
* Fast & Furious Spy Racers (2019 - 2021)

title: god_of_war
body:
A series of action-oriented games.

Loosely based on [[Greek mythology]], the initial trilogy focuses on the protagonist [[Kratos (god of war)|]] and forms part of a saga with vengeance as a central theme; with him taking vengeance on the Greek Pantheon - especially his father [[Zeus (God of War)|]].

The next two [[God of War Ragnarok|games]] in the series follows Kratos' journey in the [[Norse mythology|Norse]] realm, where he continues raising his young son [[Atreus]] in the wake of his wife [[Lauffey the Just|Faye]]'s death.

h4.Characters

* [[Sif (god of war)|]]
* [[Thor (god of war)|]]
* [[Aphrodite (god of war)|]]

h4.External links

* Wikipedia: "God of War":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/God_of_War_(video_game)]

title: predator_(1987)
body:
A 1987 [[science fiction]] horror and action film, being the first of the [i][[Predator (series)|]][/i] franchise.

Follows an elite special forces team, led by [[Dutch (Predator)|]] ([[Arnold Schwarzenegger]]), on a mission to rescue hostages from guerrillas in Central America. Unbeknownst to the group, they begin to be hunted by a technologically advanced form of extraterrestrial life, the [[Predator (character)|]].

h4. Characters

* Carl Weathers

title: merriell_allesandro_shelton
body:
[b]Corporal Merriell Allesandro "SNAFU" Shelton[/b] (January 21, 1922 – May 3, 1993) was a [[United States]] [[united_states_marine_corps|Marine]] who served in the Pacific theater during [[World War II]]. 

He is depicted in the 1981 memoir With the Old Breed: At [[battle_of_peleliu|Peleliu]] and [[battle_of_okinawa|Okinawa]] by [[Eugene Bondurant Sledge]] which chronicled their combat experiences. Snafu also appears as a character in the HBO miniseries [[The Pacific]] (2010), in which he is portrayed by American-[[Egypt]]ian actor "Rami Malek":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rami_Malek.

title: sergeant_romus_valton_burgin
body:
[b]Sergeant Romus Valton "R.V." Burgin[/b] (August 13, 1922 – April 6, 2019) was a [[United States]] [[united_states_marine_corps|Marine]] and American author. As a young man, he served in the Pacific Theater during [[World War II]].

Burgin was the author of the memoir [b]Islands of the Damned: A Marine at War in the Pacific[/b] (with William Marvel). He is portrayed in the HBO miniseries [[The Pacific]] by [[ireland|Irish]] actor "Martin McCann":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_McCann_(actor). Burgin himself appears as an old man with glasses in documentary footage during the miniseries.

title: squidbeak_splatoon
body:
The Squidbeak Splatoon was formed by [[Cap'n Cuttlefish]] after the Great [[Zapfish]] was stolen by the Octarians. He recruited [spoiler]his granddaughters, [[Callie (splatoon)|]] and [[Marie (splatoon)|]],[/spoiler] into the platoon to search for the missing Zapfish, and later persuaded Agent 3 to join the platoon as well.

This tag is for characters wearing a Squidbeak Splatoon member's costume.

h4. Members

h6. Agent 1

AKA [spoiler]Callie[/spoiler], depicted wearing a purple [[beanie]] with a [[star hat ornament]], [[sunglasses]], and a purple top.

h6. Agent 2

AKA [spoiler]Marie[/spoiler], depicted wearing a green [[baseball cap]], a face mask, and a green top.

h6. Agent 3

The [[inkling player character]] protagonist of [i][[Splatoon 1]][/i]'s Hero Mode, and can be depicted as either gender, though they are often drawn as a girl with [[green_hair|green]] [[tentacle hair]] thanks to promotional materials surrounding Hero Mode. Agent 3's costume consists of a bright yellow safety vest and pointed [[headgear]].

h6. Agent 4

The inkling protagonist of [i][[Splatoon 2]][/i]'s Hero mode, and can appear as varied as Agent 3, although most depictions are drawn as a girl with [[orange_hair|orange]] or [[blonde_hair|yellow]] hair. Agent 4's main costume difference is a [[yellow coat]].

h6. Agent 8

The protagonist of the Splatoon 2 DLC [i][[splatoon 2: octo expansion|Octo Expansion]][/i]. Unlike previous agents, Agent 8 is an [[octoling player character]], whose most common promotional appearance is with  [[purple hair]] and [[dark skin|dark]] (if girl) or [[pale skin]] (if boy).

h6. New Agent 3
The protagonist of [i][[Splatoon 3]][/i]'s Hero Mode. Like the original Agent 3 and Agent 4, their appearance is varied, but the one in promotional art will be an inkling girl and have [[blonde hair]] in a side braid, and either a yellow coat or a [[crop top]]. This is the first story mode character that can be an [[Inkling player character]] or an [[Octoling player character]].

title: thrasher_damnd
body:
A character in the [[Final Fight]] series of fighting games from [[Capcom]], and the first boss the player faces in the original Final Fight [[video game]] from the late 80s. His full name, revealed in [[Street Fighter 6]] is [b]Thrasher Damnd[/b], a combination of his censored westernized name and his original Japanese name.

[b]Damnd[/b] is a member of the [[Mad Gear]] gang that terrorized [[Metro City]]. He is a tall, [[muscular]] bound [[dark skin]]ned individual of Caribbean origin (specifically the Dominican Republic) with blonde dyed [[dreadlocks]], [[sunglasses]] and an exotic Jamaican styled outfit. 

He later appeared in [[Street Fighter 6]] as a minor antagonist and NPC in World Tour mode, where he is attempting to revive the Mad Gear gang and recruit [[player character (street fighter 6)|the player's avatar]] to join his gang.
other_names: スラッシャー・ダムド

title: mabinogi_heroes
body: Mabinogi Heroes (known in the West under the title of [i]Vindictus[/i]) is an MMORPG that is a prequel to the original [[Mabinogi]] by Nexon, set during the dark period in Mabinogi's history called the "Fomor Wars." It is a violent and action-intensive game that uses Valve's physics engine and allows players to pick up and throw just about anything in the environment at enemies. As with the original, [[Player character (mabinogi heroes)|]] fanart is common.

body: Recirah is a [[player character (mabinogi)|player]] in [[Mabinogi]]'s Mari server, known for their character Rike Herrmann. Notable features include blonde hair, blue eyes, elven ears, and their signature outfit with a white with blue tartan pattern.

title: rococo_movement
body:
Rococo was an art movement that peaked in [[France]] during the mid 18th-century. It is characterized by being extremely ornate, with intricate scrolling curves, floral motifs, pastel colors, and heavy use of gilding. At the height of its popularity, Rococo influenced architecture, fashion, furniture design, painting, and sculpture.

This tag is for images that feature Rococo influence in some way.

h4.See also
* [[art nouveau]]
* [[goth fashion]]
* [[renaissance]]

title: gothic_architecture
body:
A style of architecture which flourished during the high and late medieval period. - Wikipedia

Used to tag buildings that reflect a Gothic design. This is loosely defined and includes Early Gothic and Gothic Revival structures as well.

Characteristic design elements include the "ogive":http://www.gutenberg.org/files/33837/33837-h/33837-h.htm#fig54 (pointed arch), the "ribbed vault":http://www.pitt.edu/~medart/menuglossary/ribvault.htm, and the [[flying buttress]].

h4. See also

* [[Art Nouveau]]
* [[East Asian architecture]]
* [[goth fashion]]
* [[Greco-Roman architecture]]
* Wikipedia:"Gothic Architecture":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_architecture

title: jakuzure_nonon_(symphony_regalia)
body:
Kanade no Sou

[[Jakuzure Nonon]]'s Three Star Goku Uniform. The costume itself is a red symphony uniform with a [[shako cap]] and a slight skeletal theme, but she can also attach herself to a gigantic flying sound system. Her upgraded form seen in episode 15 has her in a pink bodysuit wearing a large shako cap and still flying around in her heart-shaped sound system.

title: inumuta_houka_(probe_regalia)
body: [[Inumuta Houka]]'s Three Star Goku uniform, resembling a technological bodysuit that he can analyze his foes with, and can utilize optical camouflage. His upgraded form seen in episode 15 has him appearing like pixellated blue blocks.

title: sanageyama_uzu_(blade_regalia)
body: [[Sanageyama Uzu]]'s Three Star Goku uniform, which resembles a heavily armored green [[bougu]]. His upgraded form seen in episode 15 has him still wearing armor, but it is less bulky and colored white. He originally possessed the skill Clairvoyance (天眼通 - Tengantsu), but later gains the more powerful skill Authority of the Mind's Eye (心眼通 - Shingantsu) [spoiler]after he requests [[Iori Shirou]] to sew his eyes shut so he can heighten his other senses.[/spoiler]

body:

A leaf flute can be recognized when a character holds a leaf horizontally near their mouth.

The style of [[bowtie]] most Westerners would point to as a "bow tie". Shaped like so: ▶◀

Commonly worn with formal male clothing such as a [[tuxedo]], and [[playboy bunny]] outfits (usually attached to a [[detached collar]]).

title: gobots
body:
[quote][i]"The Gobots are like the K-Mart of Transformers..." - "Clerks II":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clerks_II [/i][/quote]

[i][b]GoBots[/b][/i] was a line of transforming [[robot]] [[toy]]s produced by Tonka from 1983 to 1987, similar (and a rival toy line) to [[Transformers]]. 

Contrary to popular belief, [b]the GoBots brand was actually started a whole year before Transformers[/b].

The GoBots line was based on original Japanese robot toys from the first line of toys of a 1982 franchise called [[Machine Robo]] (マシンロボ) and helped create the toy robot "sensation" that swept 80s USA for a short time. The line sold well initially, but was eventually overtaken by Transformers.

Hanna Barbera produced a cartoon series called [i]Challenge of the GoBots[/i] to promote the toyline, which ran for 65 22-minute episodes from 1984 to 1985. 

The main tagline for the original animated TV series was: [i]"GoBots - Mighty Robots!!! Mighty Vehicles!!!".[/i]
 
In 1986, soon after the end of the Challenge of the Gobots television series, the Gobots co-starred with the [i]"Rock Lords":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_Lords [/i]in an animated feature film [i]GoBots: Battle of the Rock Lords[/i], again produced by Hanna Barbera.

Although initially a separate and competing franchise, Tonka's Gobots became the intellectual property of Hasbro (owners of Transformers) after their buyout of Tonka in 1991. Subsequently, the universe depicted in the animated series Challenge of the GoBots and follow-up film GoBots: Battle of the Rock Lords was established as an alternate universe within the Transformers franchise.
 
While [[Hasbro]] now owns the fictional side of the property (character names, bios, storyline), the original vintage toys and their likenesses were only licensed from [[Bandai Namco]] in the 80s, were not covered by the Tonka acquisition, and are not available for Hasbro use.

title: turbo_(gobots)
body:
A sentient variable [[robot]] of the [[GoBots]] franchise from the 80s.

[b]Turbo[/b] is an heroic member of the GoBot Guardian faction. His alternate mode is a red sports [[car]].

His [[Machine Robo]] version was originally named [b]Super Car Robo[/b].

title: donetsk_people's_republic_flag
body:
The [[flag]] of the Donetsk People’s Republic, an internationally unrecognized republic of [[Russia]] located in Ukraine's Donetsk Oblast. It was created by Russian-backed paramilitaries in 2014, and it initially operated as a breakaway state until it was annexed by Russia in 2022.

The design of the flag consists of a black stripe on top, a dark blue stripe in the center, and a red stripe on the bottom. On occasion, the region’s coat of arms may be displayed in the center, along with the Republic’s name written among it.

h4. See also
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Donetsk People's Republic":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donetsk_People%27s_Republic
* "Wikipedia: Flag of Donetsk People's Republic":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Donetsk_People%27s_Republic

title: billhook
body:
A billhook is a tool for cutting branches and grape vines, usually with a curved, concave sickle-like blade. The length of the blade and handle varies.

The weapon version of the billhook is a [[polearm]] typically with a pointed spearhead and back spike or hook in addition to the curved blade, similar to a [[halberd]]. 

Don't mix this up with the similar [[hashitsuki nata]] and [[nata (tool)]], which usually have a flat side and for which the "nose" is perpendicular to the blade, while the end of billhooks curves downward.

h4. See also

* [[Scythe]]
* [[Sickle]]
* [[Glaive (polearm)]]
* [[Halberd]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: bident
body:
A two-pronged [[spear]] resembling a [[pitchfork]], historically used both as a [[weapon]] and as a [[fishing]] tool. In folklore it is associated with demons and the underworld. Compare with the [[trident]], its three-pronged counterpart.

h4. See also:
* [[List of Weapons]]
** [[Polearm]]
*** [[Spear]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Bident":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bident

title: zooey_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character. Voiced by [[Koshimizu Ami]]. Also known as Primal Beast [b]Grand Order[/b], one of the Arbitrators who originated from [[Cosmos (granblue fantasy)|]].

Originally a summon. She was later on made into a raid boss, and afterwards into a playable character.

A [[dark skin|dark-skinned]] young woman with  long, [[ahoge|tufted]] blonde-tinted [[white hair]]. Her eye color in official art seems to fluctuate between [[red eyes|red]] and [[orange eyes|orange]]. She wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[armored dress]] and [[black thighhighs|black]] armored [[thighhighs]]. She wields a shield and an intensely blue sword.

She was given a limited summer version in 2016 despite not ever making it in the top ten female characters in popularity polls prior. This was probably to give players an easier alternative to get her, as her regular version requires one to purchase the official Granblue Fantasy visa card.

Gives herself the name [b]Zooey[/b] in her introduction fate episode, since her full name was hard to pronounce.

h4.Official alternate costumes
[[zooey (summer) (granblue fantasy)|Zooey Summer]]
other_names: ジ・オーダー・グランデ

title: chipi_chipi_chapa_chapa_(meme)
body:
"[[Dubidubidu_(christell)|]]" (also known as "chipi chipi chapa chapa", a gibberish phrase which is repeated during the chorus) is a song by Chilean singer Christell released in 2003. [[2023|20 years later]] the song would be featured in a [[meme]] which depicts a [[cat]] [[dancing]] and bobbing its head to the rhythm of the song.

h4. External Links

title: doom_(2005_movie)
body:
A film from 2005 based on the [[DOOM (series)|]] franchise. As a box office bomb, it had little impact on fan works.

The character [[Elegg (nikke)|]] from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]], utilizes a weapon that strongly resembles a yellow colored [[BFG 9000]] from this movie.

title: annie_(league_of_legends)
body:

title: erik_ahlberg
body:
A supporting character from the graphic novel and cartoon series [[hilda_(series)|Hilda]]. He's the highest-ranking member of the "Trolberg Safety Patrol", a Trolberg security agency keeping the town safe from potentially or actually dangerous magical creatures.
His main character flaw is being an extreme glory hound, ready to do anything to become as famous as his distant ancestor Edmund Ahlberg, leading him to concoct schemes that endangered other people and creatures, but in the end, [spoiler]he saw reason, saved his city and was able to facilitate peace between humans and trolls.[/spoiler]
